channel.title: Homes on Damaris Zurell research
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Damaris Zurell research

item.description: The biodiversity modelling lab I am fascinated by the question why species and individuals are where they are, how they get there and how they manage to sustain. This is central to understanding how they will respond to changes in their abiotic and biotic environment, for example due to climate change. In my team, we tackle research questions across several spatial and temporal scales. For example, we study drivers of broad-scale species distributions, of population dynamics as well as individual fitness, and their interplay with inter- and intraspecific interactions and life-history trade-offs.

item.title: People
Publications
item.description: You can find a full list of my publications here. My ResearcherID is E-2439-2012. You can also find me on ResearchGate and GoogleScholar.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching materials for practicals: Block course Species distribution modelling Practicals for MSc module Global change impacts on biodiversity Short course Introduction to the RangeshiftR package Short (half-day) course Introduction to species distribution modelling in R Teaching experience: Coordinator of MSc module “Macroecology and global change”, Univ. Potsdam, since 2020 Lecturer MSc module “Scientific writing”, HU Berlin, winter semester 2019 Coordinator of MSc module “Global change impacts on biodiversity”, HU Berlin, winter semesters 2018 and 2019 Co-advisor in course “Spatial modelling: From climate & land use change to biodiversity conservation”, ETH Zürich, autumn semesters 2016 and 2017 Lecturer within block course “Macroecology, niche evolution and climate change”, University of Zurich, autumn semester 2014 Visiting lecturer for block course “Introduction to data analysis in R for geographers”, University of Tübingen, winter semester 2012-2013 Co-advisor in block course “Advanced ecological modelling”, University of Potsdam, winter semester 2012 Co-advisor in block course “Introduction to ecological modelling”, University of Potsdam, summer semester 2011 Lecturer for seminar “Simulation methods in Hydrology and Geoecology”, University of Potsdam, winter semester 2008 Lecturer for seminar “Landscape Ecology”, University of Potsdam, summer semester 2007

item.title: Downloads
item.description: You can download some of my codes from my github site. Latest software developments in my team include: an R package for the RangeShifter platform. More info under https://rangeshifter.github.io a Shiny web app introducing and facilitating the usage of the ODMAP protocol for reporting SDM. Check out here: odmap.wsl.ch
